meanings.definition: Not fully grown or developed; immature.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was unadult and playful.
meanings.sent2: The unadult kitten was learning to climb.
meanings.sent3: The unadult squirrel kept forgetting where it buried its nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her unadult enthusiasm for cartoons was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The unadult plants in the garden needed extra care to grow.

meanings.definition: To make or become mature; grow up.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to unadult her baking skills by practicing more.
meanings.sent2: Children unadult into responsible adults over time.
meanings.sent3: He tried to unadult his wardrobe by choosing more professional outfits.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar unadulted into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent5: Learning to drive helped him unadult and gain independence.
